Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/03/2017
The manager Mark at this location is one of the best I have ever seen. My wife lived here as a graduate student, and I sometimes worried that as an international student she would run into different obstacles or management that would be impatient with the language barrier. Mark was super patient, kind, and responsive. This place is calm and quiet and close to many shopping areas and the Duke campus. Prices are very reasonable for the location. But the strongest selling point for this location is the management, especially Mark, who is one of the most caring apartment managers Ive ever come across. Thank you so much for makin me feel secure that my wife would be safe and comfortable in her apartment.

How was this review?

Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/11/2017
Let me start by saying that The Parc at University Tower has really set a new high standard for apartment living for me. I moved up to Durham for a 1 year residency, and will be leaving the state for a job afterwards. If I were to stay, I would without hesitation re-sign to live here forever (well, ok, until I bought a house or something but you know what I mean). Here's why this place is so awesome: Excellent location - right across the street (15/501) and within walking distance from a shopping center that includes Sam's Club, Target, Chick-fil-a, Autozone, Firestone, Ross, etc. Also very close to Li Ming's for international groceries. Within walking distance to a Starbucks right beside the on ramp to 501. It's only about 10 minutes from Duke University Hospital and Duke University, so many of the tenants are either students or employees there (based on a small sample size of my immediate neighbors plus the parking permits I see hanging in the cars here). Great community - this might vary depending on what you are looking for. I was looking for a quiet place without people blaring loud music at night, etc. As stated before, many tenants are professionals, and there are also a few families with young kids here (I see them waiting for the school bus by the back entrance and playing out in the parking lot). So I found what I was looking for as far as a peaceful community. There are certainly people who make good use of the grills out by the pool and management also hosts a couple events in the fall and throughout the year, but it's all pretty chill. If you're looking for some place that's more college party lifestyle, this may not be the place for you? Amazing service - This is really where the management here shines, and the factor that is most important to me in an apartment. I had previously resigned myself to the inevitable truth that all apartment management was evil and only out to make a killing off their victims/ living here has been a pleasant surprise. The team absolutely puts service first through any and all interactions you have with them, from the moment you come for a tour, and most importantly, even AFTER you've signed the lease. The team is always professional and courteous. I always drop off my check at the office because it's actually nice to interact with management, and they always make sure to ask if there is anything else I need or that they can help with. Service/repairs are amazingly prompt. I think their community rule is within 48 hours(?), but I've always had someone come within 24. They do an excellent job of maintaining the property, changing air filters, inspecting alarms, etc. And perhaps most key, they do an excellent job of communicating with their residents. If they're going to come into your apartment for community wide maintenance activities, you get a flyer at your door telling you the dates to expect it. They do a great job of holding onto packages for you, and have pretty decent hours for you to actually pick up your packages. Particularly around the holiday season, they were amazingly accommodating to ensure that everyone got their presents! Security - It's a gated community and you get double bolt locks on your door. All the neighbors seem pretty trustworthy. No concerns about security. The apartment. I'm a pretty simple girl, so no major complaints here. Appliances are well maintained and functional. Carpet is good quality. They do a good job of providing outlets along all walls. Very spacious, each unit includes a storage closet across the way. There are also garages available for additional cost if you want to have covered parking for your car. Love the natural light that I get in my apartment. Complex Amenities - free printing, access code to laundry, computers, and fitness room all available 24/7. Workout area is pretty small. I never use it (mostly because I don't really exercise, lol), but there are certainly people who do, so the equipment seems functional. I've never seen anyone use the laundry room, so can't really speak to that. Utilities - Management is very transparent about utilities/cable/internet/garbage, etc. costs on initial visit, so I won't go into that here. They'll tell you the "baseline" apartment rent and the "total" rent that has everything included. The only thing I pay as a separate bill is electricity. I keep it at 68 during winter and 78 during summer. My bill is usually <$50 (insulation on the building is pretty good).

Report
Resident
2015 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/06/2017
My husband and I stayed here for two years during my master program at Duke University. It is a very convenient location to school and also very good access to nearby grocery shopping (Fresh Market, Target, Sam's Club, and Li-Ming, the largest Asian supermarket in the area) and dining. The management and staff here are amazing- super friendly and supportive. Whenever we run into any problem, they take care of it within the same day. They helped me a lot especially for international students seeking apartment rentals overseas. We enjoy our apartment. It is spacious and clean when we moved in. It gets really hot over the summer since we are on the top floor but the benefit is there's almost no bug! We feel safe since this is a gated community and the neighbors are mostly students. It is a quiet neighborhood and the tennis court and pool are pretty nicely managed. Highly recommended!

Report
Resident
2014 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/10/2016
Parc at University Tower was a fantastic place to live. The staff are exceptional and the units are nice in terms of layout and light. The office staff are friendly and always helpful and maintenance is fast and efficient. They also help create a community feel. My apartment was large and bright and so many people told me how much they liked it when they visited (and I know it wasn't my decorating skills). The biggest issue with my apartment itself was it is an older wood built complex so insulation between apartments isn't the best. I couldn't here daily activities but my 2 year old neighbor "learning" piano could be heard. Also, bugs outside apartment are common but any time I had bugs inside someone came and dealt with it right away. Some small cons generally include the exercise room being small, the recycle bin is almost always full and if you live at the back of the complex, it's a pain to take the trash out as the only dumpster is at the front. Those things definitely shouldn't stop you from living here, it was a great apartment and I truly enjoyed living here for the last 2 years!

The Parc at University Tower is a great apartment complex. My husband and I only left because we moved away from the area for my job. The management staff are so friendly and helpful! It was always a pleasure to see Jon and Mark when I went to pay the rent or pick up a package. They made sure all maintenance needs were taken care of promptly. The management was also very helpful in planning for our move-out, especially since it was a month before the end of our lease term. The move-out process was easy and the inspection was very fair. I would highly recommend this complex to anyone looking in the area.

Report
Resident
2014 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/28/2016
I can't recommend this apartment enough. I moved to the area as a single female grad student looking for a safe community. Not only is it safe, but the staff is amazing. They're very receptive to needs and maintenance issues. They were never anything but pleasant towards me no matter the issue (though there were honestly very few issues during my two years there!). Maintenance requests are taken care of in a timely manner and they respect your schedule and priorities. The apartments have great layouts and plenty of space and storage! The only cons for me were that sometimes my area of the parking lot was pretty full and I would like to see more lightposts or brighter lights at least, for more reassurance of safety. However, I never ran into issues with safety and I thoroughly enjoyed living there. Also superb location!!

Verified Manager02/26/2016

The team at The Parc at University Tower appreciates your review about your living experience. We always strive to make sure all residents enjoy their stay here! Best Regards, Parc at University Tower Community Manager

How was this review?
Useful
Thanks for voting!
Report
Resident
2015 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/23/2016
I have been living at The Parc since August 2015. My wife and I rent a two-bed apartment. We are absolutely in love with this place. First, the management is super cooperative. Marc is an extremely jolly person who does his best to make sure you are comfortable in your place. Moving in we were told that we could put up anything on the walls, which the management takes care of once we move out. Every time - and I cannot stress this enough - EVERY time we have had an issue, they have fixed it the same day! I feel this is a great blessing considering some reviews I have read about other properties. My 'issues' have been ceiling light blubs, readjusting the flow of a/c in various rooms etc, nothing major! The appliances (stove, dish washer, washer dryer) are all in good shape and have never had issues. Second, security. Moving to Durham my main concern was security for my wife and home because I had heard about break-ins being common occurrence in Durham. The Parc is a gated community with access through a code. That can't stop determined thieves but it acts as a deterrent. Moreover, there have been no break-ins on the property which is great! Community. Most people here seem to be students from various graduate programs at Duke. The management does seem to filter people out because there has never been rowdy behavior, noise or anything. Once I received a notice about 'loud noise' which was generic for everyone in my building. Apparently, someone had complained but I hadn't heard anything to disturb my sleep or work. Which brings me to the most important point about The Parc. Building Design/Up stair noise. I have lived in countries where everything is concrete and cement so unless your neighbor upstairs decides to use a drill, you never hear anything. However, when I moved to the US, I realized that most complaint about properties is noise from the floor above. I have heard stories from my classmates of hearing their next door neighbor having sex, or the ceiling creaking every time the person upstairs even walks across his flat. Well, The Parc has no such issues! I can tell when the girls upstairs jump from their bed or run across their flat but other than that I have NEVER had my sleep or study disturbed because of the folks upstairs. Their flooring is pretty thick due to the construction method and rest assured your day or mood will never be spoiled because of folks upstairs. The pool and community area is nice. There is an on-site laundry as well in case you dont want one in your flat. The gym is small but hardly ever busy so you shouldn't have issues. Near-by: There is a Super-target and harris teeter 5 mins drive away. There is a cinema near-by as well. Driving to Duke (or Fuqua in particular) take 5-7 mins so if you are going to Duke, def check out these apartments. Lastly, I want to say that when moving to Durham I was petrified of ending up in a wrong property. The reviews I read of other places were terrible. But my wife and I feel blessed to have come across The Parc while driving to find near by living options. We couldnt have been happier!

2012 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/27/2014
My wife and I lived here with our dog from 2012 to 2014, and have seen firsthand what a difference management makes. When we first moved in, maintenance was a nightmare and the office staff was anything but helpful. Ben and his team have completely turned things around. Now when we submit a maintenance request it is fixed within 24 hours, sometimes on the same day. The new grill area is very nice, and the landscaping upgrade makes the place look and feel much newer. We happened to live under a few undergrads, who could be noisy at times, but management was quick to respond the first time things got out of hand and we haven't had any problems since. Overall, we would definitely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a quiet and safe place to live in Durham.

2008 - 2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/15/2013
When Riverstone took over management of this apartment complex, there have been more improvements and positive office behavior than in the past several management companies combined. Ample parking, beautiful landscaping which has been improved greatly by Ben Edell's ideas, upgrades to pool area with more than one grill available....granite countertops. Overall, these apartments are very well built, do not look like barracks or dorms, and are maintained by current management whose response to maintenance requests is almost immediate and done well the first time. The location is ideally located between Duke and UNC off 15-501 and minutes from Interstate 40. This is a gated community where I feel safe. I highly recommend the Parc at University Tower for many reasons, but primarily because the management staff is so wonderful!

I have a friend who lives on the walk in floor who was stole about 10k in merchant while traveling. They entered in his apartment and left anything. I don't see Parc paying much attention for these happenings. Its about the 4th time I hear about some neighborhood who had the house entered or someone tried to enter. I feel sorry to hear those burglar stories and see the staff doing nothing about it, as I know it is a great place. I don't feel safe here at all and would never live on the ground floor

Resident
2012 - 2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/06/2013
I have lived at Parc for 1 year now. In the time that I've been here, the complex has been through 3-4 different management companies. I was unhappy with all of them up until now. Riverstone group has taken over the management & is doing a WONDERFUL job! My breezeway & porch used to flood, which I complained several times to each management company about, & nothing was ever done. Then Riverstone came & fixed it immediately. They also cleaned up the pool & lots of landscaping around the complex. I am SO happy with the work they have done. As long as they are around, I will be living at this complex while I am in Durham. The folks who work at the office (Ben & Jon) are also very friendly. They always welcome you with a smile whether you're coming to pay rent, have a question/concern, or are just walking through to go to the gym or pool. The apartments are spacious & very well kept. They spray for bugs & do all sorts of other little things that most apartment complexes do not do. Sure, it costs a little extra but it's WORTH IT! Whenever I have had a maintenance issue, it has been resolved in less than 24 hours & in most cases, before I get home from work. It is a pet friendly area & they have done a fabulous job with the new dog park (which used to be a run down, dirty kids' play area). I've lived in 6 different places in the last 5 years & this is by FAR the best!!!

Report
Resident
2011 - 2013 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/01/2013
Overall, I've been very happy with the two years that I've lived at the Parc. It's usually quiet, though occasionally you can hear your upstairs neighbors. Office staff seems to have changed over 3 times since I've been here, which is a bit annoying, but everyone has been extremely nice and helpful. I've never had to wait more than one hour for maintenance to respond, and when our stove kept breaking repeatedly, they replaced all of the burners no questions asked. They recently renovated most of the apartments, but my roommate and I couldn't afford a renovated apartment, so they gave us the option of leaving it unrenovated and gave us a washer and dryer! I really can't say enough nice things about staff and maintenance. My only complaint with The Parc is the crazy additional fees. We just have basic cable, but because of some deal the complex has worked out with Time Warner, everyone must pay $100/month, regardless of their internet and cable plan. For what we have, we would not be paying that much had we been able to set up our own plan. This was only found out after I spoke with a Time Warner rep directly. There are also a lot of additional fees that usually total $50/month or so, including trash pick up, pest control, sanitation, service, and a few others. So even though rent is advertised as a certain amount, be prepared to pay over $100 more. Still, I would recommend The Parc based on it's location, apartment layout, staff, and maintenance.

11

Verified Manager04/28/2016

We are so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay here at the Parc! It's always great to hear the positive feedback from our past residents. We are also very glad that you brought up the additional fees that were present back then from 2011 - 2013, under the old ownership of the community. Since the new owners and new management took over in March of 2013 (which are still present today), those marked-up cable/internet fees were reduced significantly, and the valet waste fee (along with many other fees) are non-existent. All in all, whatever was set in place for additional fees under past ownership & management, were nearly cut in half. Again, we greatly appreciate and value your feedback! Best Regards, Community Manager Parc at University Tower

However, for a person with a job, it would be a great place to leave.

2012 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/16/2012
On top of rent, you will pay: water and sewer usage, $10 for pest control, $10 for stormwater, $13 for sanitation, $4 for recycling, $20 for trash and a $9 service fee (plus credit card processing). So if they offer you $800 for a 1 br unit, that is actually $875. It is NOT typical for apartments in Durham (or anywhere) to have so many additional fees. On the other hand, the apartments are very nice and the staff is nice as well.

Resident
0 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/12/2012
The Parc at University Tower is, in my opinion, an excellent apartment choice. This review will be from a personal standpoint/opinion of a Duke student, but most of the points should apply for anyone seeking an apartment as well. I believe the Parc provides an excellent balance between apartment quality, proximity, and price. IMO, the main issue for a Duke student/employee looking for an apartment is - outside of ridiculously expensive choices - living choices are divided simplistically into two categories: very close to Duke with known apartment/crime issues, or further away with low crime. The Parc is nice because it is within 5 minutes of Duke driving and also one of the safer apartments around (apartment is gated; I looked into crime rates before I moved in). Its location is also awesome because it is right next to Target and Li Ming (the new Asian supermarket) as well as being proximate to many eateries. In terms of the apartment itself, rent is a bit lower than similar-quality apartments in the area. The thing that prospective renters should be aware when looking (as with all apartments) is maintenance fees that are not automatically included in the rent as may be the case with other apartments. However the staff in no way tries to hid the fees as it is simply how their system is set up, and in my opinion, the total cost of living is still cheaper here than with other similar-quality apartments. Going through the rated categories below, the parking is not a problem. There are plenty of other spots around the complex if necessary, but I've never had an issue parking right next to my apartment. The noise from other tenants is negligible; I took off a star because I am a late riser and some of the grounds people are a little too aggressive with the hedge trimming a little to early in the morning for me. In that respect, the grounds are well kept. It's not the Garden of Eden, but the grass is always green and trimmed, and there is no trash anywhere. In terms of safety, the apartment is gated and I've never heard of robberies or suspicious people lurking. The maintenance and staff are excellent. We had an issue with our fridge and it took <10 minutes for the staff to respond to my email and <30 minutes for maintenance guy to arrive. He was courteous and efficient, and even checked back a few days afterward to make sure nothing else went awry. For the staff rating, I know some previous reviewers had an issue with someone named "Donna" who I have never met. If she is as bad as other reviewers suggest, it may explain why she's no longer working there. The staff that I have interacted with, Michelle and Sharon mostly, are very nice and helpful (plus free cookies). Overall I would say that I am very happy with the apartment in general, which is why I chose to write this long-ish review for them. I would highly recommend the Parc to any prospective renter.

The complex is perfect for commute to and from Duke by car, and is in a safe area around Durham. The pool and clubhouse are great, and the staff are helpful and very responsive. Apartments are clean, well-maintained, and quite spacious. Washer and dryer can be installed in the apartment for an added amount to rent, and the oversize windows are nice, too. A great place for a student or an employee who can afford to live a little more comfortably.

2009 - 2012 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/18/2012
Parc is a very nice apt complex...nice grounds, pool, tennis court. Seems to be a high turnover rate of management. Lived here 3 years and have felt very safe, love the location and my one-bedroom apt is very spacious. Seem to have competitive apt prices compared to other good apt complexes in the area. The biggest negative is the RIDICULOUS Heartland Regional Power Company that charges all residents 20$ month for trash,10$ per month recycling, 10$ per month pest control etc etc etc...adding ~$100/mo to your apt bill, not to mention the required 99$ Time Warner contract you are forced into..so take into account that you will be paying $200 on top of your apt rate each month. Work orders are responded to immediately so absolutely no complaints there. If they got rid of this Heartland monopoly it would be the ideal apt complex to live in.

Report
Resident
2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/19/2011
Convenient but not worth it. You will see a lot of advertising and promises to entice new residents. Once you are here and locked into a lease, nothing is done to persuade you to stay. In fact, it seems they do quite a bit to chase you away. My advice to potential residents of the Parc would be to ask a lot of questions. In my experience, several key things were "glossed over" in the lease signing (and resigning) process. For example, my rent has increased by $20/month each year; there is a separate fee for water, trash, and assorted other times - $70 /month; and it is IMPOSSIBLE to be released from this lease regardless of the circumstances (job loss, transfer, death...) While we pay at least $30/month for "sanitation, recycling and trash", the trash and recycle bins are always overflowing with trash scattered about. These fees, paid to Heartland Regional Utilities, came without warning when the Connor Group took over this complex. The exterior of the buildings was just repainted and looks nice; the pool is nice too. Parking is OK but sometimes spaces are hard to get at my building. Nothing much was done to clear ice/snow from sidewalks and the parking lot in the winter. The local managers are courteous, polite and seem to want to make living here a good experience. It appears their hands are tied at the corporate level. I will not live in a Connor Group property again.

Resident
2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/18/2011
If you read the other recent postings, you will notice most of the negative comments are about the Connor Group and/or Heartland Regional Utilities rather than about the complex itself. Yes, the gate malfunctions periodically and the landscaping could stand some work, but our main issues are with the unannounced increases that have made our rent ridiculous. If one goes to the Connor Group website, there are tabs for "customer service" and "contact us". Do not be fooled. There is NO customer service. If you call, you get an operator who cannot connect you to any live person. She can take a message and try to pass it along to a regional manager who works only via his/her cell phone. If you email them, they do not respond. Or they contact the local manager and have him/her respond to you. When asked point blank if anyone from Connor would ever contact me directly after 5 phone messages and an email, I was told "No. They don't work that way." So... know what you are getting into before you sign a lease with any Connor Group properties. Why people continue to work for them, I don't know. I hope they can sleep at night.

I agree with you on Heartland cause they have nonsense fees (plus the $3 charge for paying with credit card?), but completely disagree on the other things. When you say a day late on rent, do you mean a day after the five day grace period? Either way, perhaps you should pay your rent on time and there won't be a problem. Also, the people in the management office are really cool and helpful so you should talk to them if you're going to be late, and try to work something out. As for walk-through and security deposit, I just moved out last month and scheduled a walk through. I was behind on my packing so I pushed back the walk-through 3-4 times and Michelle was more than accommodating. Also, I got my full security deposit back a couple of days ago (although it was late). So your claims are just straight up false. I preferred the Sherman owners over the Connor group in terms of fees and all that. But the people in the front from the Connor group are awesome. I built a good relationship with them (and even the "evil" Donna before they switched), and my experience there was great.

Resident
2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/30/2011
I moved in sight unseen, and I couldn't be happier. The location was much more convenient than I expected (within two miles of everything I'd need, and a 4 minute through-the-forest drive to Duke's campus). The management has been consistently pleasant, personable, responsive and flexible. Parking is ample, the grounds are great and continually improving with their landscape projects, and we're had four maintenance requests in the last 9 months, each of which the staff addressed within a day. My only less than perfect feedback is that the walls are thin enough to hear my roommate decently well when he's talking at normal volume, and we hear the upstairs neighbors quite a bit (sometimes creaking with regular, adult walking, and quite a bit from the running of their child). With that said, it's better than most apartments I've lived in. Also, Parc is really chill, not the place to move if you're looking for the part scene. But it's within 10 minutes of Station 9 and others if you're a student and looking for that. All around great place.

Report
Resident
2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/16/2010
I am now in my third year of living at the Parc at University Tower. It is a really beautiful complex with a tennis court, pool, and lots of grassy areas. What you can't see from just visiting the complex, however, is the manipulative practicies of the new management company, The Connor Group. Before The Connor Group took over, I paid an extra $25.00 in addition to my rent for water, trash removal, and service fees. When The Connor Group arrived this summer, however, things changed dramatically. When the time came for me to renew my lease, I was forced to sign a "Water Addendum" (or else I would be unable to renew and therefore have to move). It was coercive - no negotiations, just "You have to sign this form or else you cannot renew your lease." It increased my monthly bill to more than $70.00. I couldn't say no because I couldn't afford to move - but now I am stuck paying more than $600.00 more than I had budgeted for this year. That's almost a FULL MONTH of rent that I am now paying. To put this in perspective, the "Trash Fee" alone is $20.00 (for the privilege of hauling your trash down to the community dumpster). Comparison - at Alexan Place, it is $7.00, and they pick the trash up at your doorstep free of charge. The "pest fee" is $8.99, even though the pest man doesn't even come into your apartment. The "sanitation fee" is $13.00. Yes, this is correct - they don't even keep the complex clean without charging you for it! The "stormwater fee" this month was $10.00. So far I cannot find another complex that charges their residents for stormwater. If you move here and The Connor Group is in charge, BEWARE. It is difficult to move again, and the management knows it and will use that fact to raise your costs to make money off of you. It's not just at this complex - in fact, if you research The Connor Group on Google, you will find that it has been the subject of countless tenant complaints. Here are some links: http://www.apartmentratings.com/rate/GA-Atlanta-Morningside-Courts-formerly-Hawthorne-Courts-1078878.html http://www.ripoffreport.com/Landlords/Arbors-Of-Watermark/arbors-of-watermark-apartments-qdq85.htm http://www.apartmentreviews.net/ratings/ohio/columbus/bent-tree-apartments-r26914.htm http://raleigh.citysearch.com/profile/13943816/morrisville_nc/connor_group.html Even the employees admit that it is a terrible company to work for (and one even speaks to its "brainwashing," which must explain why the manager here at the Parc seems to believe that a $20.00/month trash fee is reasonable): http://www.jobvent.com/review-of-job-at-the-connor-group-R79522 BOTTOM LINE: I WISH I COULD MOVE OUT. This place used to be great, and it's sad to see what it will probably become when you read the above reviews. My recommendations: Alexan Place or Pinnacle Ridge.

anonymous 09/15/2010

BY USA laws in all states, when youre a renter for an apartment, condo, duplex or home, even a room to rent...the landlord HAS to pay for all pest control issues. They are legally liable. If they also changed the lease terms without drawing up a new lease, take them to court! Trust me, I know what Im talking about on this. You dont even need an attorney...you can go thru a paralegal and they will make the company pay the fee's. There is NO court in the USA that can change lease terms without drawing up a new lease and getting you to sign. Even if you chose not to stay there any longer, get them in court! They will not show up, they will do away with their lease changing on current tentants as they can only change things on new tenants. Once youre in the door, whatever your terms are...new ownership HAS to stick to the USA laws. Call an attorney or paralegal that will speak with you free the first time, once they know you will win, they will take the case and the company pays their fee. I went thru this with another rental company on my own a few months back, I paid much of my rent late with their saying "its okay just add the late fee" and when the new owner took over and said they are adding trash and water fee's when it was included, the attorney got me one full year of rent that I was paying at that time the day they walked out of the courtroom. Mind you, I did pay my rent late each month, and still got this. Dont let them get away with it. You dont even need to go to court, the attorneys and their paralegal's do it all.

Resident
2009 - 2010 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/25/2010
I moved to the Parc at UT late last year with a three-month lease, as I was going to be a visiting researcher at Duke. The management was very accommodating in working out a good rate for the short lease. I have since also had to extend my stay for another three months, and have had no problems in the extension as the management has been very understanding. The apartment management is no doubt one of the best I have come across, and as for the apartments they are top notch as well. The location is perfect for anyone working at Duke. It is an amazingly beautiful 5-minute drive on Academy Road. The buildings were constructed not many years before, and this is apparent in the individual units. I had a couple of maintenance issues upon moving in, but those were taken care of in a flash. Parking has never been a problem, as there are plenty of empty spaces even when the buildings are entirely rented out. The only complaint/suggestion I have is the size of the clothes care facility and the quality of the washer-dryer units, but each individual unit has washer-dryer hookups, so for anyone living long term, renting washer-dryer units will probably make more sense. UPDATE: I wrote the review above. When I was moving out, I found out that Connor Group was taking over the property. Parc was awesome with Sherman Residential, but I cannot say the same with the change of management. I have heard horror stories about Connor Group, and thus wanted to make sure everyone understands that the above review was based on experience with the previous management, and before moving in here you should do your research about Connor Group.

I read these reviews before I moved here a year and a half ago. I'll admit I was somewhat hesitant because of all the bad things said about Donna. A year and a half in, I'm still waiting to see that mean, rude lady people spoke of. Don't take my word for it, come and meet her... and you can decide for yourself. Just let other people deter you from this great community. As for the apartments, they are very spacious for the price (I used to live in L.A. so these are a bargain), clean very well maintained. Also, a major concern here is safety. In the time I've been here, I've seen 1 car broken into and some other cars vandalized (keyed). That very good in most places, and even better considering comparable complexes in the area. If it's really a concern for you, like it was for me, rent a garage for about $50-$70 more a month. Downside is that the trash is outside the gate, but you get used to it after complaining about it for a month or two.

The community is now called "The Parc At University Tower". We lived there for one year (July 2006 to July 2007). We made our decision to rent there based mostly on the courtesy and prompt replies of a [now] former employee because we could not afford at the time an actual visit to Durham, NC. The apartment we rented was a one bedroom at the last floor, facing south towards the trees in the inner yard between the buildings. We found it spacious, in good working condition, and clean. Throughout the year we only had a couple of problems, one related to the light outside main door and the other related to the temperature inside during summer (the loft runs a few good degrees warmer than the rest of the apartment). Both times the maintenance technicians were prompt and fixed the issues right away. We had no noise issues with our neighbors. The head of the office is a very dedicated and hard-working person and we felt that her personal qualities added to the good impression we've got about our short-lived stay there. Overall, for us it was a _very_ good place to live.

Report
Resident
2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/16/2004
This complex is relatively new and well maintained. The apartments are spacious, clean, light, and well-maintained. The grounds are well-groomed. Security is not an issue due to the location and gated entrances. Parking is ample and the lots are well-maintained. The complex is generally well insulated from road noise, and individual apartments are nicely situated to avoid reverberations from stairs or neighbors. Occupants tend to be quiet and respectful, furthering the quiet peaceful atmosphere. Staff is helpful but not intrusive. The gym is the only drawback, but there seems to be little demand for improved facilities anyway. On the whole, this is the best housing option for single or married graduate students or young professionals not interested in buying real estate in the area.

The complex is generally well insulated from road noise, and individual apartments are nicely situated to avoid reverberations from stairs or neighbors. Occupants tend to be quiet and respectful, furthering the quiet peaceful atmosphere. Staff is helpful but not intrusive. The gym is the only drawback, but there seems to be little demand for improved facilities anyway. On the whole, this is the best housing option for single or married graduate students or young professionals not interested in buying real estate in the area. Read less

The WORST THING is that the reason I moved into that place was because it was gated -- too bad the gate only works about 15% of the time (that´s being charitable). If you have any interest in safety, pick Pinnacle Ridge or Summit Square -- at least their security gates actually work. What´s the point of paying high rent for a gate that´s barely operational?
